column4: Would anyone care to suggest a good module for 'Intel Corporation Centrino Wireless-N 1030 (rev 34)' wifi card?
Because the stock one is killing me.
it's in the default install, you just need to disable n speed
do you dual boot?
Not yet to be honest, MonkeyDust. Didn't know they exist.
something like iwconfig wlan0 modu <> , you mean?
Thanks a lot, MonkeyDust.
do you dual boot?
yup I do.
then in Windows disable the devices ability to wake up the OS as well as disable power management
trueneu those chips also have a hard time with n speed wifi, so you may need to disable that if the link keeps dropping off
Erm, my second OS is not Windows. I think I can disable those from BIOS.
there is no 'second OS', you just dual boot
boot to windows and you can do it in device manager
Let's say I don't boot into Windows. I have no Windows installed.
So I can't boot into it as it's not my second OS. =)
then try running: echo "options iwlagn 11n_disable50=1 11n_disable=1" | sudo tee /etc/modprobe.d/iwlagn.conf > /dev/null
I'll try to disable n modulation then, thanks.
Uh-huh, thanks a lot.
you may also need to run:  echo "iwlagn" | sudo tee -a /etc/modules > /dev/null
makes the driver load
